entry.title: Farmers Who Protect the Amazon Rainforest Would Like to Be Paid
entry.content: Some in Brazil say they would protect forests on their land if compensated through a carbon-credit program on the agenda at the climate-change summit now under way in Glasgow.

entry.title: Venice Artisans Pushed to the Brink by Gas Crisis
entry.content: Traditional glassmakers, an industry that dates back about a thousand years in Venice, has become a victim of the energy crunch that is rippling through the global economy.

entry.title: Nicaragua Veers Toward Dictatorship
entry.content: President Daniel Ortega, running for a fourth consecutive term after imprisoning seven rivals, is widely expected to win an election seen as a sham by the U.S. and opponents.
